Start a simulation by double-clicking on a Scenario, let it load and start executing.  Then, hit the global "stop" button on the simulation control.  That causes the exception to be thrown.
I have fixed this problem, now it is working without the exception being thrown. Please get the new code, and close the bug if it works for you.

Fixed bug. The problem was that we still get simulation events while the simulation control is being disposed. I have included some checks to verify that the sequencer is not null and the progress bar is not disposed when there is a new event. This prevents from using disposed widgets which was the cause of the exception.
